body_html:
rebuild libtorch in test.sh

Definitely please don't do this :)

What if I told CMake to install libtorch artifacts to a directory outside the source tree instead of tools/cpp_build/build/Install?

I think something like this is definitely preferred, because at the end of the day the preferred way to use libtorch is to install it somehow, and then use it, right? Furthermore, our build of libtorch is done completely independently of PyTorch, so there really is no reason to install it into the tools directory. So if you install it somewhere outside of pytorch that would be great.

body:
> rebuild libtorch in test.sh

Definitely please don't do this :)

> What if I told CMake to install libtorch artifacts to a directory outside the source tree instead of tools/cpp_build/build/Install?

I think something like this is definitely preferred, because at the end of the day the preferred way to use libtorch is to install it somehow, and then use it, right? Furthermore, our build of `libtorch` is done completely independently of PyTorch, so there really is no reason to install it into the `tools` directory. So if you install it somewhere outside of `pytorch` that would be great.
